steps.text: In a medium saucepan, place heavy cream, vanilla bean, pod and scrapings. Heat over medium-high heat until mixture comes to a boil.
Remove pan from heat, let cool for 15 minutes.  After cooled, remove vanilla bean, save for another use.
In a medium bowl whisk 1/2 cup of the sugar with the egg yolks until well blended and starts to lighten in color.
Add cream mixture to egg mixture slowly (temper), while whisking the egg mixture constantly.
Divide mixture evenly between six seven or eight ounce ramekins. Place ramekins into roasting pan over a dish towel (or paper towel). Pour hot water into pan to come halfway up ramekins.
Bake until custard is set (35-40 minutes), but still trembling in center.
Let cool for 5-10 minutes, then place in fridge for at least 2 hours.  Custard will keep for up to 3 days in the fridge.
When ready to serve, remove ramekins from fridge and let sit at room temperature for 30 minutes.
Divide remaining 1/2 cup sugar among the 6 ramekins.  Spread sugar evenly over top.
Use culinary torch to melt sugar and form a crispy top.  Let cool for 5 minutes before serving.
